Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Peptide AN5-1 (natural AMPs; bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBMm; BBN)

Literature Information.Literature: bactericidal, inducing cell lysis in E. coli ATCC 29522 and S. aureus, and non-cell lysis in both S. marcescens and B. cereus ATCC 14579.Activity:  active against S. enteritidis ATCC 13076 (MIC 4-8 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 4-8 ug/ml);  Enterobacter spp. (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), S. marcescens (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), L. plantarum ATCC 8014 (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), B. subtilis (MIC 16-32 ug/ml);  B. cereus ATCC 14579 (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 64 ug/ml); and  B.anthracis (MIC 128 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria: This peptide can disrupt bacterial membranes and bind to DNA (Yi T et al., 2014).Peptide stability:  pH-insensitive (2-12) and heat-stable after exposure to 100oC. Updated 10/2014; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Alkotaini B, Anuar N, Kadhum AA, Sani AA.2013
Literature Information.Title: Detection of secreted antimicrobial peptides isolated from cell-free culture supernatant of Paenibacillus alvei AN5.
